full_job_description:
Panel Wirer
Contract role 
Machine Building Industry
Leicester, LE8
Days Shifts - Early Finish Friday
Pay rate £22 CIS or £17 Paye 
Are you an experienced Panel Wirer looking for an exciting Contract opportunity within a developing industry? If yes, read on.... 
I'm excited to share an opportunity with a forward-thinking engineering company that's on the lookout for an experienced Panel Wireman or Control Wirer. This is an ideal role for someone who thrives in high-precision environments and has a proven track record in Panel Wiring. 
The Role - Panel Wirer:
- Building and wiring control panels
- Machine wiring
- Working to wiring schematics
- Using a variety of hand tools
- Day Shifts, Early Finish Friday
Minimum Skills / Experience Required - Panel Wireman:
- Extensive experience in panel wiring or machine control wiring
- Strong understanding and experience with schematics
- Ability to use the required hand tools
- The ability to work with minimal supervision and deliver high standards
- Problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Motivated and excellent team player
- Able to commute to the LE8 area
The Package - Electrical Fitter:
- Basic salary of £17 per hour paye or £22 CIS
- Overtime available daily
- Free onsite parking

PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership. 
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidates expectations.

full_job_description:
Experience Required -  Production Supervisor Fabrication shop  Engineering Manufacturing Industry Leicester LE3  Up to £36k Per Annum Day Shifts - Early Finish Friday 
 Are you an experienced Supervisor, Team Leader or Workshop Manager from the Engineering Manufacturing industry? Would you like to lead and develop a motivated team within an established family-owned business?  
Our client is a leading engineering manufacturer based in Leicester. They are currently looking for new Production Supervisor to run their fabrication workshop.  
 Commutable from Coventry, Hinckley, Rugby, Nuneaton and other areas close to South Leicestershire.  
The Role - Fabrication supervisor  
- To lead, motivate and manage a team of fabricators on a daily basis.
- Liaising with the office regarding bespoke requirements and sharing thoughts and experience regarding more complex specifications.
- To oversee all works being carried out in the workshop to ensure customer satisfaction at all times.
- Interpreting drawings received.
- Welding various fabricated material.
- Oversee laser cutting, shearing, folding, punching, and rubbering material using the relevant machinery.
- Arranging adequate and relevant training for new and existing staff as necessary.
- Working with other staff members effectively by coordinating workload.
- Adhering to health and safety regulations.
- All other duties as required that are considered to be a reasonable employer request.
- At least 5 years' experience in metal sheet fabrication.
- Competent with all aspect of fabrication.
- Use of CAD drawings
- Forklift licence would be preferable but not essential
- Accurate measuring ability and good numeracy skills and experience of using measuring equipment.
- The ability to understand the drawings provided.
- Relevant qualifications would be desirable.
- Previous welding/sheet metal experience essential.
- Amada machinery experience preferable.
The Package - Fabrication/shop floor supervisor   
- Starting salary up to £36k per annum
- Pension
- Day Shifts - Mon to Thurs 07.30-16.30, Friday 07.30-1400
About PrecisionPeople  
PrecisionPeople is a leading recruitment agency that specialises in sourcing top talent for Engineering, Technical, Sales and Senior Management roles across a wide range of industries. With a focus on precision and quality, their team of expert recruiters works tirelessly to match the best candidates with the right employers, ensuring that both parties benefit from a successful partnership.  
PrecisionPeople has the expertise and resources to help you find the perfect role. With a deep understanding of the industry and a commitment to excellence, they have built a reputation for delivering exceptional results and exceeding their candidate's expectations.  
 Interested? To apply for this Production Supervisor position, here are your two options:  
1. "This is the job for me! When can I start?" - Call (phone number removed) now and let's discuss your experience. Ask for Sharon Pickering between 0730 am - 4.30 pm  
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure I have enough to get an interview" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and let you know  
 INDTEMP

full_job_description:
Are you a skilled MIG Welder Fabricator looking for your next opportunity? We're working with a well-established and growing engineering firm in Loughborough who are looking to add to their friendly team. This role offers great rates of pay, steady day shifts,.

What You'll Be Doing

- Working from detailed engineering drawings
- MIG welding 1mm - 3mm Aluminium, mild steel and stainless steel
- TIG welding
- Fabricating components to a high standard
- Reporting to the Fabrication Manager
- Occasionally working independently on varied jobs and materials

What We're Looking For

- Skilled welder/fabricator
- Strong background in MIG Welding
- Experience in TIG welding would be advantageous
- Confident reading technical drawings
- 3+ years experience working in the catering industry
- Point of sale experience would be advantageous
- Someone who can hit the ground running and work on their own initiative

Why You'll Love It Here

- Excellent hourly rate - up to £18.00 ph
- Day shifts only

salary_benefits: £40,000 - £50,000/annum (Up to £50k depending on experience), Competitive salary and benefits package.
full_job_description:
Quality Engineer
Up to £50k (depending on experience)
Are you a detail-driven Quality Engineer with a passion for continuous improvement and a strong understanding of ISO standards? This is an exciting opportunity to join a forward thinking electronics manufacturer, where you'll play a key role in driving quality excellence across all areas of the business.
About the Role
As a Quality Engineer, you'll take ownership of the company's Quality Management System (QMS), ensuring compliance to ISO 9001 and supporting implementation of ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 standards. You'll lead both internal and external audits, oversee non conformance processes, and provide hands-on support across the business to promote a culture of quality and continuous improvement.
Working closely with production, suppliers, and customers, you'll manage warranty investigations, ensure compliance with environmental and safety regulations, and help maintain the highest levels of product integrity.
Key Responsibilities
- Administer, develop and maintain the company QMS in line with ISO 9001 standards.
- Support implementation and compliance with ISO 14001 and ISO 45001.
- Conduct and manage internal and external quality audits.
- Manage non-conformance reporting, root cause analysis and 8D corrective actions.
- Handle warranty adjudication - including receipt, assessment and logging.
- Support the development and documentation of SOPs and business processes.
- Drive continuous improvement through lean and problem-solving methodologies.
- Ensure customer and supplier compliance with standards such as REACH, RoHS and ESG.
- Prepare and manage quality documentation including PPAP, APQP, Control Plans, FMEA and SQA processes.
- Facilitate and support external audits and compliance checks.
About You
My Client are looking for someone who brings:
- Proven experience within a Quality Engineering role, ideally in an electronics or manufacturing environment.
- Strong understanding of ISO 9001, with exposure to ISO 14001 and ISO 45001.
- Experience with PLM/ERP systems and customer compliance standards (REACH, RoHS, ESG).
- A tenacious, detail-oriented approach and commitment to "right first time" quality.
- Excellent problem-solving skills with experience in root cause analysis and corrective actions.
- A proactive attitude towards continuous improvement and customer satisfaction.
Why Join Them?
- Be part of a growing, innovative UK manufacturer.
- Lead quality initiatives that make a real difference.
- Work in a supportive environment where your ideas and expertise are valued.
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
Interested? Here are your three options
1. "This is the job for me, I meet all the requirements" - Call now and let's talk through your experience. Ask for Jon Webster on between 8.30am - 5.30pm
2. "I think I'm right for this position, but I'm not sure about some of the detail" - Click "apply now" so I can read your CV and come back to you.
3. "I'm interested but need to know more about what this job can offer me" - email (url removed) with your CV and questions and I will reply with more detail.
Precision is committed to keeping our candidates informed and offers a guaranteed response within 7 days when applying through the application system.
PPTP

full_job_description:
About the Company:
A well-established engineering and manufacturing business, recognised for producing high-quality sheet metal and fabricated components for a range of industries. With ongoing investment in modern machinery and a commitment to developing their people, they're now seeking an experienced Press Brake Setter Operator to join their team.

The Press Brake Setter Operator Role:
As a Press Brake Setter Operator, you'll be responsible for setting, operating, and adjusting CNC press brake machines to produce precision sheet metal parts in line with customer specifications.

Key Responsibilities:
- Set and operate CNC press brake machines (Amada, Bystronic, Trumpf, or similar).
- Read and interpret technical drawings and engineering plans.
- Carry out first-off inspections and ensure quality throughout production.
- Adjust machine settings and tooling to achieve accurate folds and dimensions.
- Maintain equipment, report faults, and ensure safe working practices.
- Work efficiently to meet production targets and deadlines.

About You
- Proven experience setting and operating CNC press brakes.
- Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings.
- Positive, proactive attitude with good communication skills.

full_job_description:
Assistant General Manager
Leicester City Centre
Up to £35,000 DOE
Full-Time, Daytime Hours, Weekends Essential
Do you want to progress into a General Manager role within the next 6 months?
Our client is a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant built on friendship, connection, and exceptional coffee. Their calm, design-led space offers a welcoming home for people who appreciate craft — from perfectly pulled espresso shots to beautifully plated brunch dishes. Due to their growth, they are expanding their leadership team and are looking for an ambitious professional to join their team. This role is ideal for a seasoned hospitality manager with strong barista skills and a passion for people.
The role
Assistant General Manager
- Oversee daily operations, service flow, and team performance.
- Uphold high standards of coffee, food, and atmosphere.
- Manage compliance, rotas, stock control, and reporting.
- Lead by example during busy brunch periods.
- Manage stock control, cost efficiency and supplier orders.
Senior Barista (essential)
- Lead all aspects of coffee preparation, training, and quality control.
- Support daily operations, rotas, and guest experience alongside the GM.
- Act as floor lead when the GM is away.
- Maintain EHO and hygiene compliance with precision and care.
- Maintain excellent customer service ensuring all issues are resolved
The candidate:
- Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting.
- Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level.
- Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable
- Confident in workflow management and team leadership.
- Weekend availability essential.
What is on offer:
- Competitive pay (based on experience)
- Daytime hours: typically between 08:00–19:00
- Opportunities for growth within a creative, design-led concept
- Supportive and inspiring working culture
Interested? Please click ‘Apply’ today!
description_snippet: This is a Full-Time Assistant General Manager role in Leicester City Centre with a salary up to £35,000 DOE, requiring daytime hours and essential weekend availability. The client is a Scandinavian–New York inspired brunch restaurant looking for an ambitious professional to join their leadership team. This role is ideal for a seasoned hospitality manager with strong barista skills and a passion for people, with the potential to progress into a General Manager role within 6 months.

Requirements include: Minimum 2 years’ management experience in a premium café, brunch restaurant, or boutique hospitality setting; Minimum 2 years’ barista experience, ideally at senior or lead level; Basic food hygiene or EHO knowledge desirable; Confident in workflow management and team leadership; Weekend availability essential.

full_job_description: Want to see your welds make a real impact? If you’ve got MIG welding experience and want to join a company that actually invests in your skills, this is the one. You’ll be working on high quality sheet metal projects for major customers, using modern equipment in a clean, organised workshop where precision and pride really matter. This is a busy, long established manufacturer in Loughborough with around 100 staff and a full order book stretching well into next year. They’re known locally for looking after their people, promoting from within and offering genuine training opportunities to help you progress in your career. Job Title: MIG Welder Location: Loughborough, Leicestershire Hours: Rotating shifts Monday to Friday, 06:00-14:00 / 14:00-22:00 Contract Type: Permanent Pay: £14.00 - £15.50 per hour (based on experience, reviewed after probation). Your Responsibilities: Carry out MIG welding on sheet metal components, ensuring strong and accurate welds Set up and adjust welding equipment for various materials and specifications Read and interpret engineering drawings to achieve precise, consistent results Perform quality checks using measuring tools to verify weld integrity Support grinding and finishing of welded components as required. What We’re Looking For (Requirements): Proven experience in MIG welding within a manufacturing or fabrication environment Ability to interpret drawings and produce accurate, high quality welds Competence with grinders, finishing tools and fabrication equipment A good eye for detail and pride in producing clean, professional work Reliable, adaptable and confident working both independently and as part of a team. Recruitment Process Details: To apply, simply upload your CV below or contact Josh Whitmore on (phone number removed) or (url removed). £55,000 - £60,000/annum

full_job_description:
A growing engineering business specialising in the design and manufacture of bespoke automation and mechanical systems is seeking an experienced Engineering Project Manager to join its expanding team. The company operates across regulated and industrial sectors, delivering complex, high-precision systems that meet demanding technical and regulatory standards.
As a well-established and employee-focused organisation, the business continues to invest in innovation and people, with a strong pipeline of new projects and long-term customer partnerships.
**The Role**  
 As Engineering Project Manager, you’ll take ownership of multiple projects from initial concept through to final delivery. You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.
This is a hands-on, delivery-focused position that requires both technical understanding and strong commercial acumen. You’ll work closely with customers, engineering teams, and senior stakeholders to drive accountability and successful outcomes across the full project lifecycle.
**Key Responsibilities**
- Lead and manage several concurrent engineering projects (typically 3–4 at a time) from concept through to completion.
- Ensure all projects meet contractual and commercial milestones, including agreed payment stages.
- Take ownership of project budgets, costings, and margins.
- Plan and allocate resources effectively across design, build, and commissioning teams.
- Lead structured design reviews and ensure adherence to engineering standards and compliance requirements.
- Act as the main customer contact throughout the project, managing scope changes, risks, and technical queries.
- Ensure projects meet internal quality, documentation, and handover standards.
- Drive continuous improvement across processes, design delivery, and communication.
**About You**  
 We’re looking for an experienced and proactive Project Manager with a strong background in automation, machinery, or special-purpose equipment design. You’ll be commercially aware, technically capable, and confident managing cross-functional teams and customers in a dynamic environment.
**Key Skills & Experience**
- Degree-qualified in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline.
- Minimum 10 years’ experience managing engineering or automation projects.
- Strong technical understanding of automated systems, robotics, or machinery.
- Proven experience in regulated or high-precision industries (medical, healthcare, packaging, etc.).
- Confident managing budgets, timelines, and multi-disciplinary engineering teams.
- Skilled communicator with the ability to manage stakeholders at all levels.
- Proficient in Microsoft Project or similar project management tools.
**Personal Attributes**
- Hands-on and delivery-focused with a strong sense of ownership.
- Collaborative, calm under pressure, and customer-oriented.
- Able to balance technical, commercial, and operational priorities effectively.
- Willingness to travel occasionally within the UK and overseas.
**What’s on Offer**
- Competitive salary and benefits package.
- Opportunity to lead innovative engineering projects with real impact.
- A supportive environment with autonomy, variety, and career growth potential.
- Work within a forward-thinking, employee-driven business investing in technology and people.
If this role would be of interest to you, please click apply today.

You will oversee planning, coordination, and execution across mechanical, electrical, software, and build disciplines—ensuring projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards. full_job_description: Job Opportunity: CAD/CAM Engineer (Sheet Metal Manufacturing) Location: Leicester, East Midlands Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE) Hours: Monday - Thursday, 07:30 - 16:00 (40 hours per week), Friday 12:30 Finish Type: Permanent, Full-Time Start Date: Immediate About the Company Our client is a leading UK metal manufacturing specialist, they partner with major national brands across industries such as rail, transport, retail, and construction. A family-run business, they pride themselves on their commitment to quality, investment in cutting-edge technology, and dedication to developing their people. With over 100 skilled employees, the company continues to grow year-on-year thanks to its focus on innovation, craftsmanship, and exceptional customer service. The Role: CAD/CAM Engineer As a CAD/CAM Engineer, you will play a crucial role in producing high-quality and dimensionally accurate engineering drawings and CNC programs for the manufacturing of sheet metal components. You will work closely with production and clients to ensure orders meet technical specifications, efficiency standards, and quality expectations. Key Responsibilities - Create accurate 2D CAD/CAM profiles in line with client specifications. - Develop CNC programs that maximise efficiency in material use and machine time. - Produce detailed manufacturing drawings for press, fabrication, and assembly operations. - Update and modify CAD/CNC data as required. - Maintain organised drawing and program records. - Communicate clearly with clients regarding order details and requirements. - Prepare Bill of Materials (BOM) lists for the purchasing team to ensure all project materials are available. Skills & Experience Essential: - Proficiency in 2D CAD software (AutoCAD or TruTops preferred). - Strong SolidWorks experience (sheet metal design essential). - Solid understanding of sheet metal manufacturing processes. - Confident user of MS Office / Office 365, particularly Excel and Teams. Desirable: - Experience with Trumpf CAM software (advantageous but not essential). Personal Attributes - Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy in work. - Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. - Professional, approachable, and adaptable attitude. - Focused and reliable under pressure. - Innovative problem-solving and critical thinking skills. - Enthusiastic about developing a long-term career in manufacturing. Benefits - Salary: £27,000 - £32,000 per annum (DOE). - Quarterly bonus scheme (non-contractual). - Life assurance. - Enhanced holiday entitlement with service-linked increases. - Pension scheme. - Company-provided workwear and PPE. - On-site gym, canteen, and parking. - Employee Assistance Programme. - Continuous training and career development opportunities. About Regional Recruitment Services This role is advertised by Regional Recruitment Services Ltd, an award-winning independent recruitment agency established in 2008. We specialise in connecting skilled professionals to opportunities across the Engineering, Industrial, and Technical sectors. Contact Us: (phone number removed) Visit: (url removed) If you are passionate about precision engineering and want to progress your career with a respected and growing manufacturer, apply today or call our Industrial team for more details.

full_job_description:
Customer Service Team Leader
Location: Leicester
Salary: Up to £40,000 per annum
Contract: Permanent, full-time (37.5 hours, Monday-Friday)
A leading international engineering and manufacturing group with a long-standing presence in Leicester is seeking an experienced Customer Service Team Leader to manage a small but busy team within their customer operations function. This is an exciting opportunity to join a world-class organisation supplying vibration control and precision-engineered products across multiple industries, including automotive, rail and industrial markets.
The Role
You'll be responsible for leading, coaching and developing a team of four Customer Service professionals, ensuring that all customer orders and enquiries are handled accurately, efficiently, and with exceptional service. Working closely with supply chain, production, and commercial teams, you'll be the central link between customers and internal operations - driving communication, problem resolution and continuous improvement.
Key Responsibilities
· Lead, motivate and develop the Customer Service team to achieve departmental targets.
· Manage order entry, processing, and order book monitoring to ensure timely fulfilment.
· Build strong operational relationships with key customers through proactive communication and problem-solving.
· Collaborate with Supply Chain, Sales, and S&OP teams to forecast and resolve delivery challenges.
· Manage customer portals (such as SupplyOn) and maintain accurate data and documentation.
· Support finance with invoice queries, credit/debit notes, and proactive communication on blocked deliveries.
· Lead root-cause reviews following delivery or service issues, implementing "lessons learned" improvements.
· Ensure compliance with export, customs and quality requirements for all customer deliveries.
· Monitor customer KPIs and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across the department.
About You
You'll be a confident communicator and natural leader with a solid background in customer service or supply chain, ideally within a manufacturing or engineering environment. You know how to manage people, systems and process flow to deliver exceptional results.
Requirements:
· Degree qualified (or equivalent experience through a proven track record).
· Minimum 5 years' experience in Customer Service, Supply Chain or similar function.
· Demonstrated experience in people management and process improvement.
· Proficient in ERP systems (preferably M3) and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
· Organised, proactive, and detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset.
· Business fluent in English; additional languages an advantage.
What's on Offer
· Up to £40,000 per annum.
· 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
· 10% discretionary bonus (up to 20% maximum).
· Free onsite parking and EV charging.
· Subsidised canteen.
· Employee Assistance Programme and wellbeing portal.
· A supportive, collaborative working environment with real career development potential.
This is a site-based role in Leicester, with occasional international travel if required.
If you're a driven and people-focused professional with a passion for service excellence and operational efficiency, we'd love to hear from you.
Barker Ross Group values diversity and promotes equality. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate against any of the protected characteristics that fall under the Equality Act 2010. We encourage and welcome applications from all sections of society and are more than happy to discuss reasonable adjustments and/or additional arrangements as required to support your application.
For the purposes of the Conduct Regulations 2003, when advertising permanent vacancies we are acting as an Employment Agency, and when advertising temporary/contract vacancies we are acting as an Employment Business.
description_snippet: A leading international engineering and manufacturing group in Leicester is seeking an experienced Customer Service Team Leader to manage a small, busy team within their customer operations function. This permanent, full-time role (37.5 hours, Monday-Friday) involves leading, coaching, and developing a team of four Customer Service professionals to ensure all customer orders and enquiries are handled accurately and efficiently. The Team Leader will act as the central link between customers and internal operations (supply chain, production, and commercial teams), driving communication, problem resolution, and continuous improvement for a world-class organisation supplying vibration control and precision-engineered products across multiple industries (automotive, rail, and industrial markets).
responsibilities_snippet: Key Responsibilities: Lead, motivate and develop the Customer Service team to achieve departmental targets. Manage order entry, processing, and order book monitoring to ensure timely fulfilment. Build strong operational relationships with key customers through proactive communication and problem-solving. Collaborate with Supply Chain, Sales, and S&OP teams to forecast and resolve delivery challenges. Manage customer portals (such as SupplyOn) and maintain accurate data and documentation. Support finance with invoice queries, credit/debit notes, and proactive communication on blocked deliveries. Lead root-cause reviews following delivery or service issues, implementing "lessons learned" improvements. Ensure compliance with export, customs and quality requirements for all customer deliveries. Monitor customer KPIs and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across the department. Requirements/Skills: Confident communicator and natural leader. Solid background in customer service or supply chain, ideally within a manufacturing or engineering environment. Ability to manage people, systems and process flow to deliver exceptional results. Degree qualified (or equivalent experience through a proven track record). Minimum 5 years' experience in Customer Service, Supply Chain or similar function. Demonstrated experience in people management and process improvement. Proficient in ERP systems (preferably M3) and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Organised, proactive, and detail-oriented with a problem-solving mindset. Business fluent in English; additional languages an advantage. Machinery Skills Needed: Proficient in ERP systems (preferably M3). Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel. Experience managing customer portals (such as SupplyOn).
